body_html:
Sounds good. I should be able to get these done tonight.
…
On Mar 4, 2017 3:17 AM, "Adam Paszke" ***@***.***> wrote: ***@***.**** commented on this pull request. Can you please add a test? ------------------------------ In torch/utils/data/dataloader.py <#908 (comment)>: > @@ -72,7 +73,7 @@ def default_collate(batch): return torch.LongTensor(batch) elif isinstance(batch[0], float): return torch.DoubleTensor(batch) - elif isinstance(batch[0], str): This actually eliminates the need for the first case handled in this function (unicode). Can you please remove it? Also, I think it'd be better to create a string_classes tuple that contains (basestring,) for Python2 and (str, bytes) for Python3. This would add support for bytes objects. — You are receiving this because you authored the thread. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#908 (review)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAIbIBamZYiVwre2DwOhu9wXxrCG6SGUks5riUg6gaJpZM4MSBE7> .
body_text:
Sounds good. I should be able to get these done tonight.
…
On Mar 4, 2017 3:17 AM, "Adam Paszke" ***@***.***> wrote:
 ***@***.**** commented on this pull request.

 Can you please add a test?
 ------------------------------

 In torch/utils/data/dataloader.py
 <#908 (comment)>:

 > @@ -72,7 +73,7 @@ def default_collate(batch):
          return torch.LongTensor(batch)
      elif isinstance(batch[0], float):
          return torch.DoubleTensor(batch)
 -    elif isinstance(batch[0], str):

 This actually eliminates the need for the first case handled in this
 function (unicode). Can you please remove it? Also, I think it'd be better
 to create a string_classes tuple that contains (basestring,) for Python2
 and (str, bytes) for Python3. This would add support for bytes objects.

 —
 You are receiving this because you authored the thread.
 Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
 <#908 (review)>,
 or mute the thread
 <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAIbIBamZYiVwre2DwOhu9wXxrCG6SGUks5riUg6gaJpZM4MSBE7>
 .
body:
Sounds good. I should be able to get these done tonight.

On Mar 4, 2017 3:17 AM, "Adam Paszke" <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> *@apaszke* commented on this pull request.
>
> Can you please add a test?
> ------------------------------
>
> In torch/utils/data/dataloader.py
> <https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/908#discussion_r104286108>:
>
> > @@ -72,7 +73,7 @@ def default_collate(batch):
>          return torch.LongTensor(batch)
>      elif isinstance(batch[0], float):
>          return torch.DoubleTensor(batch)
> -    elif isinstance(batch[0], str):
>
> This actually eliminates the need for the first case handled in this
> function (unicode). Can you please remove it? Also, I think it'd be better
> to create a string_classes tuple that contains (basestring,) for Python2
> and (str, bytes) for Python3. This would add support for bytes objects.
>
> —
